pageContext.title: In brief: Singapore property agent listing site gets $730k seed funding
pageContext.content:
Propseller, a Singaporean startup helping property sellers and landlords find and compare brokers or agents, announced it has closed a US$730,460 (S$1 million) seed round from industry entrepreneurs and senior executives.

Source: Propseller

Among the investors were Singapore-based startup founders Erwan Mace of Muslim Pro and Yang Bin Kwok of Zopim.

Propseller claims to be the “first and only independent player that collects and verifies ratings, as well as analyzes historical transaction data of agents from any agency in Singapore.”

To date, the startup has listed 500 curated agents who are managing US$365 million (S$500 million) worth of properties for sale.

Propseller will use the money it just raised to expand across the region and further develop its tech.

seo.title: In brief: Singapore's Propseller nabs $730k seed funding
seo.description: Propseller aims to connect more property sellers and agents in Asia.
